intro: Schiedea implexa, commonly known as the Hawaiian redstem, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed areas, often at mid to high elevations. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Schiedea implexa is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the unique biodiversity of Hawaii's flora.
